rComments: You have to study but she knows her stuff and is always willing to explain to you. Tests were hard but she told you exactly what would be on them so no surprises. Hardest part - way too much vocab. You'd have to know 300 potential words for a test and get asked 10 of them. But I learned more grammar in this class than 4 years of high school.

Do NOT take her for SPN3300. She is undoubtedly brilliant and kind, but she operates her class of SPN3300 in a manner that makes it more difficult that any other teacher at the Spanish department. You have to learn a ton of vocab, while most of the other teachers ignore it or gloss over it. She also grades surprisingly hard on presentations.

LOVED her: she's such an easy grader and very helpful. i would recommend this upper level spanish class to any spanish majors or minors. you can miss up to 5 days i think and still have it not effect your participation grade. 4 homework assignments, 4 tests, and NO FINAL
